item.title: Microsoft Visual SourceSafe cleanup in Windows
item.description: I was migrating some old source code that was version controlled in Microsoft Visual SourceSafe (or vss) into Subversion. I wanted to cleanup the files and subfolders in the project root. By cleanup, I mean get rid of the vss metadata and reset the file permissions. Vss adds a .scc file and sets all the files to read-only.
